questions.prompt: In BG 10.1, what does Krishna offer to reveal to Arjuna?
choices: Mystical powers through material manipulation and discipline
Military strategies for winning the imminent battle
My divine opulences and supreme position
Knowledge of worldly success and political influence
questions.feedback: Krishna reveals His transcendental nature and all-pervading power.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.2, what is the source of understanding Krishna?
choices: He is beyond even demigods and saints
Logical analysis of material phenomena and reasoning
Sensory experience and philosophical speculation combined
Study of Vedic texts without devotional practice
questions.feedback: Krishna is the ultimate source; His nature is beyond external knowledge.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.3, what characterizes one who truly knows Krishna?
choices: Hesitation between material and spiritual paths
Attachment to family duties and worldly obligations
Freedom from delusion with complete devotion
Philosophical uncertainty about the ultimate nature of reality
questions.feedback: True knowledge of Krishna purifies consciousness completely.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.4-5 teach about Krishna's divine manifestations?
choices: Consciousness arises from complex material arrangements
Divine qualities emerge from material nature itself
Spiritual powers develop through personal austerity
All divine qualities originate from His nature
questions.feedback: All divine qualities originate from Krishna's supreme nature.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.8, what is Krishna's fundamental assertion?
choices: I am bound by material nature's laws
I am the source of all creation
I rely on the support of others
I appear in this world just like you
questions.feedback: Krishna states that He is the ultimate source of all creation. Everything emanates from Him, and all rest upon His potency. Nothing exists independently of Him. This fundamental truth establishes Krishna's absolute supremacy as the creator and sustainer of the cosmos.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.10, what does Krishna promise to those absorbed in Him?
choices: Intelligence to attain His eternal abode
Momentary peace from material anxieties and troubles
Gradual separation from His direct divine presence
Philosophical uncertainty about the ultimate goal
questions.feedback: Those devoted to Krishna receive divine intelligence to know Him.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.11 teach about Krishna's compassion?
choices: He destroys ignorance with transcendental knowledge
He remains neutral toward His devotees' struggles
He withdraws to cultivate their independence
He tests devotees with philosophical doubts
questions.feedback: Krishna's compassionate enlightenment destroys ignorance completely.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.13, how is Krishna addressed by great authorities?
choices: As one powerful personality among many others
As the Supreme Truth by Brahma and sages
As subordinate to the impersonal Brahman effulgence
As inferior to the supreme material energy
questions.feedback: All great spiritual authorities recognize Krishna as the Supreme.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.14, what does Krishna claim to know?
choices: Awareness limited by material conditioning and forms
All divine manifestations and opulences completely
Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
Partial understanding of the material manifestations
questions.feedback: Krishna possesses complete knowledge of all divine qualities.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.15 teach about knowing Krishna fully?
choices: One who knows attains eternal peace
Philosophical understanding provides intellectual satisfaction only
Such knowledge serves secondary purposes in life
Theoretical understanding brings negligible practical benefits
questions.feedback: Complete knowledge of Krishna grants eternal peace and fulfillment.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.20, what is Krishna's declaration about His nature?
choices: I appear and disappear within material cycles
I am the Self, beginning middle and end
I depend on the Supreme Brahman's support
I am confined by time and space
questions.feedback: Krishna's presence pervades and sustains the entire creation.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.21, what example does Krishna give of His opulences in the material world?
choices: I withdraw my presence from natural phenomena
Matter operates entirely through independent laws
I am fire and OM among elements
I exhibit few manifestations in visible creation
questions.feedback: Krishna manifests His divine power through all creation.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.22 teach about the highest of Krishna's manifestations?
choices: I rank among the lesser transcendent principles
All manifestations possess equivalent power and position
Divine manifestations function independently of each other
All rests on Me like pearls on thread
questions.feedback: Krishna is the supreme foundation of all existence.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.23, who among great personalities is the foremost?
choices: All Adityas possess identical levels of power
I am Vishnu, superior to all
No hierarchy exists among divine beings
Great personalities exist without any mutual connection
questions.feedback: Krishna is supreme among all divine manifestations.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.24, what is Krishna among the senses?
choices: I am the mind and life in beings
Matter provides the foundation of all perception
He remains absent from material sense perception
He lacks direct control over sensory experiences
questions.feedback: Krishna is the source of consciousness and sensation in all beings.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.25 teach about Krishna among the celestial beings?
choices: Demigods operate independently of His supreme will
He ranks below the most powerful demigods
I am Indra, the king among them
He withdraws from the realm of devas
questions.feedback: Krishna is supreme even among the powerful demigods.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.26, what weapon represents Krishna?
choices: He lacks the ability to manifest power
He possesses diminished strength compared to matter
Divine weapons operate completely independently of Him
I am the thunderbolt and Kamadhenu
questions.feedback: Krishna manifests His might through all powerful forces.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.27, what generation of the Yadavas is Krishna?
choices: He possesses diminished status among His kinsmen
He descends from a different royal lineage
I am Vasudeva; I am Krishna
His position remains subordinate to elder Yadavas
questions.feedback: Krishna revealed His supreme position among His own kinsmen.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.28 teach about Krishna's function?
choices: I am the seed; none exists without Me
I rely on nature's energy for existence
I provide minimal support to manifested reality
Creation operates entirely through independent material laws
questions.feedback: Every atom of creation depends on Krishna's potency.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.29, what brings unlimited strength and power?
choices: Mastery of technical skills and knowledge
Dedicated scriptural study without devotional service
Accumulation of material wealth and possessions
My association and divine grace
questions.feedback: Association with Krishna grants supreme power and strength.

questions.prompt: In the conclusion of Chapter 10, what is the central message?
choices: I am everything; meditate on this truth
I possess limited power in material affairs
Set aside divine considerations for worldly duties
Material success should remain the primary focus
questions.feedback: Remembering Krishna's supreme nature is the path to all perfection.

questions.prompt: According to BG 10.39, what should be the meditation of the devotee?
choices: Pursue material advancement for spiritual progress
Absorption in family and social obligations
Fix your mind upon Krishna exclusively
Balance divine and worldly concerns equally
questions.feedback: Exclusive focus on Krishna leads to the highest spiritual achievement.

questions.prompt: In BG 10.40, what is promised to those who meditate on Krishna?
choices: Gradual distancing from Krishna's divine presence
Continued struggle within the material world
Increasing material suffering over lifetimes
I am never absent from you
questions.feedback: Krishna's eternal presence with devoted souls is guaranteed.

questions.prompt: What does BG 10.41 emphasize about Krishna's position?
choices: He depends on material energy for support
All splendor is My partial manifestation
He possesses diminished power in material affairs
He remains absent from worldly beautiful phenomena
questions.feedback: All glory, beauty, and power in existence reflects Krishna's nature.

questions.prompt: According to the concluding teaching of Chapter 10, what should one understand?
choices: Krishna holds a subordinate position in reality
Material energy operates independently of divine control
Set aside transcendental knowledge for practical affairs
I am supreme; all power flows from Me
questions.feedback: Understanding Krishna as supreme is the perfection of all knowledge.
